newsitem.title: USA: Fannie Mae ups the sizes of three REMICs.
newsitem.headline: Fannie Mae ups the sizes of three REMICs.

text.p: Fannie Mae on Wednesday said it has increased the sizes of three previously issued series of Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC) securities.

REMIC trust 1997-18, issued via Credit Suisse First Boston, was increased to $305 million from $250 million, Fannie Mae said. The issue is backed by 30-year, 7.5 percent mortgage-backed securities and 30-year, 9.0 percent Government National Mortgage Association (GNMA) certificates. The issue has a settlement date of March 27.

REMIC trust 1997-19, issued via Paine Webber Group Inc, was increased to $703 million from $500 million, the agency said. The issue is backed by 30-year, 7.0 percent and 7.5 percent mortgage-backed certificates and various FNMA REMIC tranches, Fannie Mae said. The new settlement date is March, 27.

REMIC trust 1997-21, issued via Nomura Securities, was increased to $340 million from $300 million, the agency said. The issue is backed by 30-year, 8.0 percent mortgage-backed certificates and various Fannie Mae REMIC tranches. The issue has a settlement date of March 31.
